SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.Gui.guiControllers

Class ClientLoginController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.Gui.guiControllers.ClientLoginController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ClientLoginController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class governs the GUI of the phase in which the user enters the login information that will then be used to connect the player to the game or the pre-game lobby. It is used as an intermediary between the fixed parts of the GUI of the 'ClientLogin.fxml' file and the dynamic information that the controller sends to the graphic components of the associated fxml file. In addition, the class manages the interaction between the user and the various graphic components of the scene.
Author:
Alberto Aniballi

      public ClientLoginController()

  • Method Details

    • setChosenUsername

      public void setChosenUsername(String chosenUsername)
      This method is used to set the name that a new player chooses during the pre-game lobby. In this way the name of the new player is stored, later it will be sent to the controller.
      Parameters:
      chosenUsername - the name of the player.

    • setChosenTechnology

      public void setChosenTechnology(int chosenTechnology)
      This method is used to set the technology that a new player chooses during the pre-game lobby. The technology can be of type socket or rmi, it will be used to connect the player to the server throughout the entire game without the possibility to change it afterward.
      Parameters:
      chosenTechnology - the chosen technology.

    • setChosenIPAddress

      public void setChosenIPAddress(String chosenIPAddress)
      This method is used to set the ip address that a new player chooses during the pre-game lobby. The chosen ip address will be used to connect the player to the server throughout the entire game without the possibility to change it afterward.
      Parameters:
      chosenIPAddress - the chosen ip address;

    • setChosenPort

      public void setChosenPort(int chosenPort)
      This method is used to set the port number that a new player chooses during the pre-game lobby. The chosen port number will be used to connect the player to the server throughout the entire game without the possibility to change it afterward.
      Parameters:
      chosenPort - the chosen port number.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is used to initialize the fxml controller of the client login GUI.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - the url used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - the resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • getUsernameFromInput

      public boolean getUsernameFromInput()
      This method is used to retrieve, from the dedicated text field, the name that a new player writes.
      Returns:
      boolean: true if name is in good format

    • getServerTechnologyFromInput

      public void getServerTechnologyFromInput(javafx.scene.control.RadioButton radioButton)
      This method is used to retrieve the technology that a new player clicks on the "technology type" radio button. Furthermore, this method updates the default ip address and port number on the server text field and port number text field.
      Parameters:
      radioButton - the radio button used to show available technology types.

    • getServerFromInput

      public boolean getServerFromInput()
      This method is used to retrieve, from the dedicated text field, the server that a new player writes.
      Returns:
      boolean: true if IP is in good format

    • getPortFromInput

      public boolean getPortFromInput()
      This method is used to retrieve, from the dedicated text field, the port number that a new player writes.
      Returns:
      boolean: true if port is in good format

    • onLogin

      public void onLogin()
      This method is used to send all the information, collected from the player, to the controller. It notifies the controller by creating a new "OBS_InitialInfoMessage" message. In case some data are not correct, it shows an error pop up and ask again the data
